FuncDef: The reset dhcp snooping statistics command resets statistics on the number of discarded DHCP packets.
CLIs: reset dhcp snooping statistics { vlan <vlan-id> [ interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } ] | interface { <interface-name> | <interface-type> <interface-number> } | bridge-domain <bd-id> }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates statistics on the number of DHCP packets that are discarded in a VLAN.
The value of vlan-id is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the type and number of an interface. It indicates statistics on the number of DHCP packets that are discarded on an interface.
-

Specifies the name of an interface. It indicates statistics on the number of DHCP packets that are discarded on an interface.
-

Specifies the BD ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the alarm function for discarded DHCP packets is enabled, the system counts the number of discarded DHCP packets. To get accurate statistics on the number of discarded DHCP packets after DHCP snooping is enabled, run the reset dhcp snooping statistics command to reset statistics on the number of discarded DHCP packets.
